steps.title: The Traditional Senior
steps.narration: You can design solid integrations. Retries, circuit breakers, idempotency‚Äîyou know all the patterns. But your impact is limited to integrations you personally build and review.

steps.title: The Impact Ceiling
steps.narration: Traditional seniors impact their team. One integration at a time. One code review at a time. Your expertise helps, but only where you can personally touch the code.

steps.title: The Amplified Shift
steps.narration: What if you could define integration patterns once, and have AI generate compliant implementations across all teams? Your expertise scales beyond what you can personally touch.

steps.title: Define Patterns Once
steps.narration: You do the work once: define the patterns, create templates, write validation rules. This is where your senior expertise shines‚Äîyou know what good looks like.

steps.title: AI Multiplies Your Impact
steps.narration: AI does the work many times: generates code, creates docs, checks compliance. Every team gets the same quality you'd deliver personally. Your patterns scale across the organization.

steps.title: Four Strategic Pillars
steps.narration: Move from designing individual integrations to defining organizational strategy. Four pillars: Patterns, Contracts, Observability, and Governance. Master these, and you shape how your entire company connects systems.

steps.title: Patterns Pillar
steps.narration: What are the standard ways we connect systems? When do we use sync versus async? What's our retry and backoff standard? How do we handle partial failures? Define these once for everyone.

steps.title: Contracts Pillar
steps.narration: How do services define what they expect from each other? OpenAPI specifications, versioning strategy, breaking change policy. Contracts prevent integration chaos as the organization grows.

steps.title: Observability Pillar
steps.narration: How do we know integrations are healthy? Required metrics, distributed tracing, alerting thresholds. If you can't see it, you can't fix it. Make visibility a requirement, not an afterthought.

steps.title: Governance Pillar
steps.narration: Who decides what and when? New integration approval, deprecation procedures, security reviews. Governance isn't bureaucracy‚Äîit's clarity about ownership and responsibility.

steps.title: AI as Your Multiplier
steps.narration: Once you define the strategy, AI becomes your implementation multiplier. Your patterns become prompts. Your standards become validation rules. Your expertise generates code across every team.

steps.title: Prompt Engineering for Integrations
steps.narration: Write prompts that encode your standards: retry patterns, circuit breaker config, timeout values, authentication method. Give AI the API spec and your rules‚Äîit generates compliant clients every time.

steps.title: The Integration Checklist
steps.narration: Authentication, error handling, rate limiting, observability‚Äîdefine the checklist once. AI ensures every integration meets the standard. No more inconsistent implementations across teams.

steps.title: Template Library
steps.narration: Create reference implementations for sync clients, async clients, webhook handlers. AI uses these as examples to generate new integrations that match your architectural style exactly.

steps.title: Amplified Impact
steps.narration: Define it once, AI implements it everywhere. Your integration expertise now shapes every service connection in the company. That's amplified senior impact‚Äîplatform-wide influence.

questions.question: What limits a traditional senior engineer's integration impact?
options: Impact limited to integrations they personally build and review
questions.explanation: Traditional seniors are limited by what they can personally touch. Amplified seniors define patterns that scale their expertise across the entire organization through AI.

questions.question: What's the key to scaling your integration expertise?
options: Work longer hours to review more code
Define patterns once that AI can implement consistently everywhere
Let AI design everything without guidance
questions.explanation: Define patterns, templates, and validation rules once. AI multiplies your expertise by generating compliant code across all teams, far beyond what you could personally build.

questions.question: How does an amplified senior's impact differ from a traditional senior?
options: They impact their team vs the entire organization
They don't need to understand integrations
They only work on new projects
questions.explanation: Traditional seniors impact their team (one integration at a time). Amplified seniors define patterns that shape integrations organization-wide through AI-generated implementations.

questions.question: What are the four pillars of integration strategy?
questions.explanation: The four pillars are: Patterns (how we connect), Contracts (what services expect), Observability (how we monitor), and Governance (who decides what). These shape organizational integration strategy.

questions.question: Why is the Contracts pillar important?
options: It defines what services expect from each other, preventing integration chaos
It's not important, just nice to have
questions.explanation: Contracts (OpenAPI specs, versioning, breaking change policies) define expectations between services. Without clear contracts, integration chaos grows as the organization scales.

questions.question: What does the Governance pillar address?
options: Who decides what and when‚Äîapproval, deprecation, security reviews
questions.explanation: Governance provides clarity: new integration approval, deprecation procedures, security requirements. It's not bureaucracy‚Äîit's clarity about ownership and responsibility.

questions.question: How do you turn your standards into AI prompts?
options: Let AI figure out the standards
Encode retry patterns, circuit breaker config, timeouts, and auth in the prompt
Just paste code and hope for the best
questions.explanation: Your prompts should encode your standards: retry patterns, circuit breaker config, timeout values, authentication methods. Give AI the spec plus your rules for consistent output.

questions.question: What's the purpose of an integration checklist?
options: To ensure every integration meets the same standard consistently
questions.explanation: The checklist (auth, error handling, rate limiting, observability) ensures consistent quality. AI uses it to validate that every generated integration meets your standards.

questions.question: What is 'amplified impact' in integration strategy?
options: Defining patterns once that AI implements everywhere, scaling your expertise organization-wide
questions.explanation: Amplified impact means your integration expertise shapes every service connection in the company. Define it once, AI implements it everywhere‚Äîplatform-wide influence.
